posts.title: Ping Pong
posts.excerpt: The film traces the growth and friendship of two very different high-school ping-pong players. “Peco” Hoshino is a brash, arrogant player, determined to turn pro. He taught his quiet, nerdy childhood friend “Smile” Tsukimoto. Smile frustrates his coach and rivals, who recognize his talent for the game since it is just a game to him. …

posts.title: Homicidal
posts.excerpt: Quote: Gimmicky B-movie fright master William Castle (THE TINGLER, STRAIT JACKET) enters the adventurous (for 1961!) world of gender psychology in this effective suspense picture. Bombshell Emily (Jean Arless) murders the justice of the peace after he marries her to Warren (Glen Corbett) a hotel bellboy whom she paid to do so. The odd couple …

posts.title: The Naked City
posts.excerpt: Plot Synopsis: Young model Jean Dexter is knocked unconscious and drowned in her own bathtub in her Manhattan apartment, and a lot of jewelry that she supposedly owned is missing. The Naked City is actually about six days in the life of New York City that coincide with the murder and the subsequent investigation by …

posts._title: Robert Gardner – Screening Room: Hollis Frampton (1977)
posts.title: Screening Room: Hollis Frampton
posts.excerpt: “Screening Room was developed and hosted by filmmaker Robert Gardner, who at the time, was Director of Harvard’s Visual Arts Center and Chairman of its Visual and Environmental Studies Department. posts._title: Sergio Martino – I corpi presentano tracce di violenza carnale AKA Torso (1973)
posts.title: I corpi presentano tracce di violenza carnale
posts.excerpt: SYNOPSIS A fetishistic killer is on the loose, a madman in a balaclava who enjoys murdering young women (and occasionally men, if they happen to get in the way). When two university students drop dead, Jane (Suzy Kendall) and her three friends, Daniela (Tina Aumont), Katia (Angela Covello) and Ursula (Carla Brait), decide to high-tail …

posts.title: Dangerous Seductress
posts.excerpt: The Evil Queen returns to possess an American girl who she orders to go out and claim victims to sate her blood lust.

posts.title: Ghost World
posts.excerpt: from the Fantagraphics website: “Ghost World avoids all the clichés of the gen-X genre, presenting a melancholy, affecting portrait of two teen-age girls, best friends whose intertwined lives afford them a certain sanity, while the threat of separation brings home the tenuousnes of their shared reality.” “[Clowes] demonstrates that the medium, in the hands of …

posts.title: Black Hole (1995 – 2005)
posts.excerpt: Quote: November 7, 2005 | “Everything’s either concave or -vex,” the Danish poet Piet Hein once wrote, “so whatever you dream will be something with sex.” In Charles Burns’ decade-in-the-making graphic novel “Black Hole,” the natural concavity and -vexity of everything leaps out at you: Nearly every image is a sexual metaphor, with the distorted …

posts._title: Claude Sautet – Vincent, François, Paul… et les autres AKA Vincent, François, Paul and the Others (1974)
posts.title: Vincent, François, Paul… et les autres
posts.excerpt: Description: Three friends face mid-life crises. Paul is a writer who’s blocked. François has lost his ideals and practices medicine for the money; his wife grows distant, even hostile. The charming Vincent, everyone’s favorite, faces bankruptcy, his mistress leaves him, and his wife, from whom he’s separated, wants a divorce. The strains on the men …

posts._title: Yasujiro Ozu – Banshun aka Late Spring (1949)
posts.title: Banshun
posts.excerpt: Plot from allmovie by Hal Erickson Veteran Japanese writer/director Yasujiro Ozu’s second postwar production was 1949’s Late Spring or Banshun. Chisu Ryu plays another of Ozu’s realistic middle-class types, this time a widower with a marriageable daughter. Not wishing to see the girl resign herself to spinsterhood, Ryu pretends that he himself is about to …
